column1: length ball wide outside off, left alone
beats the outside edge with some swing. Wobbles in and then out as he reaches out away from the body for a cover drive. A puff of dust as that hits the surface, in the first over itself
length on middle stump, punched back to the bowler on the up
short ball slanted across off stump, hangs the bat out aimlessly and is beaten
good length and down leg side, closes the face too early on the flick and it rolls into the off side
overpitched outside off stump, gets to the pitch and drills it between non-striker and mid-off
back of a length and swinging away wildly, way outside off. Batsman doesn't go after that
good length and just outside off, defended solidly on the front foot
good length and bending away outside off again, left alone. This was marginal, could have been called wide
inswinger starts outside off and traps him on the pad as he looks to flick across the line. But he has gotten outside off stump and is safe
short of a length and skidding straight outside off, left alone
123kph, good length and shaping in at the corridor. Defended on the front foot
good length and wide outside off. Reaches out again with a stride and clips this across the line to deep square

plumb! Beaten on the inside edge as he plonks the front leg across yet again. This length ball pitches in the corridor and nips back in. He's caught playing the wrong line and is struck dead in front of off stump. No doubt about that, and his partner tells him
short of a length across the corridor. Dabs it into the off side with an angled bat
outside edge sails over gully and trickles to third man. Length ball going across him and he chases it with hard hands, away from the body
back of a length in the corridor, he shapes to defend but withdraws the bat at the last moment to let it through
full and just outside off, driven to mid-off from the toe-end of the game
slower ball on a good length, just outside off stump. Defended to point on the front foot
slides this length ball down leg side, Shakib leaves
good length and big swing into the left hander. He's unable to control the swing. This is deflected behind square leg off the pad
good length and shaping in at off stump, blocked on the front foot
flicks aerially but it's wide of midwicket. Full and coming into the pads and he reaches out well in front of the body. Not in control there
good length and in at off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length and coming into the pads, dabbed through square leg off the back foot
good length and swinging in sharply. Jabs it on the up into the leg side
back of a length on middle stump, gets on top of the bounce and checks the punch to midwicket
good length and lifting up at off stump. Defended on the front foot off the high part of the bat
short of a length on off stump, defended into the covers off the back foot
short of a length and just outside off. Doesn't come on as he hopes. The cut is off the toe-end and straight to point

cut uppishly but in the gap again. It's a loose shot, to be fair. Short ball in the corridor. Not too much room and he isn't on top of the bounce. In the air as he cuts and it lobs between point and cover
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full inswinger on leg stump, driven to mid-on
inswinger on a length at off stump, dead-batted into the pitch with a gap between bat and pad
full inswinger at leg stump again, punched to mid-on uppishly

Zimbabwe think they have Shakib caught behind down leg side. They've reviewed. It's going down leg side and he looks to flick it. Slight sound as he does so and it goes through to Taylor...but it doesn't matter. He has overstepped. It works out for Zimbabwe, they would have lost that review. It was off the pad.
full toss wide outside off. Backs away to try and flay this through cover. Toe-ends it into the off side
good length and shaping away outside off, left alone
good length and in at off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, walks at the ball and stabs as he's on the move. Thick outside edge lands in front of gully

flies past the slip fielder! Oh they had two slips last over, this one would have gone straight to the second one. Length ball climbs on Shakib as he chases with no feet. Big edge. First slip leaps to his left but that's too quick for him
keeps low and just misses off stump. In the corridor on a length, skids through at knee height as he anticipates this to come up at him on the back foot
full on leg stump, driven to mid-on
short of a length just outside off, chops it to gully off the under-edge
lovely shot. Nicely to the pitch of it outside off, drives through the line right off the middle of the bat and beats mid-off to his right
length and rising into the body. Pokes it through square leg on the up
good length and swinging down leg side, left alone
good length and swinging in at off stump. Pushes hard in front of the body and gets it out to mid-off. Big gap between bat and pad
good length and sliding outside off. Looks to drive on the up and under-edges into the pitch
good length and in at leg stump, tapped into the leg side
full and wide outside off, driven handsomely on the up past mid-off. Leans into this and uses his core strength as he springs while hitting this
walks down the track and guides this incoming ball to fine leg
walks at it again. Length ball just outside off and he wafts at it on the move. Thick outside edge wide of third man
good length and just outside off, beaten on the outside edge as he looks to defend on the front foot
good length just outside off, tapped into the covers on the front foot
full and just outside off. Almost yorks himself with the stride and is forced to dig it out, but he does well enough to beat Cremer's dive at mid-off
back of a length in the corridor, allows it to come on and steers it to third man
short of a length on middle stump, nudged through square leg off the back foot
length ball fired in on a middle stump, lifts off the pitch and takes the leading edge as he closes the face too early
back of a length on middle stump, angling across the batsman. Gets deep in the crease and taps it to square leg
good length just outside off, driven on the up towards mid-off
back of a length on middle stump, defended square into the off side off the back foot
back of a length on leg stump, tapped to fine leg from the crease
ah ruins a good over. Length ball on leg stump. Tamim stays put in the crease with a half-stride, and tickles it fine
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length and turning away from off stump, can't get this flick away against the turn. Dribbles back towards the bowler
back of a length on middle, hurriedly tapped to extra cover
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-off off the back foot
floated full and down leg side. Tamim can't connect on the flick as this spins back in. Taylor doesn't anticipate the turn and it skids through from between his legs
length on leg stump, flicked to square leg
good length on leg stump, defended on the front foot
good length on off stump, defended into the covers on the front foot
good length and just outside off. Tapped to point on the up
good length and just outside off, driven on the up to extra cover
sharp bouncer. A pity he's penalised for it. This spits up at Shakib and he's late as he swivels to try and hook. Resists in the end and watches it sail over his front shoulder
good length on off stump, leading edge to backward point as he defends on the back foot
full and just outside off, driven on the up to extra cover
back of a length, skids through and strikes him on the pads in front of middle as he looks to flick off the back foot. Pitched outside leg
full and just outside off, flicked to deep midwicket on the front foot
good length and drifted in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
floated up outside off, reaches out and turns it to deep midwicket on the full
good length, lopped up at leg stump. Defended on the front foot with a big reach and hard hands
good length outside off, pushed to point's right on the front foot. His throw at the non-striker's end is not backed up and they get a second at deep midwicket
good length and slanted across the corridor. Drives on the up off the low part of the bat and it ends up a chip over the non-striker. Enough bat for the boundary
short of a length just outside off, stands tall and steers to third man
short and wide outside off, pushed to third man with an open face

top edge as he struggles under another bouncer. This is heading for his throat and he takes his eyes off as he looks to hook. No room at all, and he's in a poor position for that shot. Four from over the keeper
good length and just outside off, driven on the up to extra cover
short and wide outside off, cut straight to point on the bounce
good length and dropping at an off stump line. Pushes forward and drops it into the leg side with soft hands
short and turning into middle stump, backs away and slices it past backward point
good length and wide outside off. Pushed through cover on the front foot
back of a length outside off, tapped to sweeper on the back foot
good length on leg stump, deflected wide of short fine off the front foot
back of a length and spinning in at leg stump, glanced wide of short fine off the back foot
loopy ball drifted in at leg stump. Steps out and doesn't make the pitch. Wafts forcefully at it and gets a thick outside edge to backward point's left
good length on middle stump, on the back foot to work this to deep midwicket
short of a length on off stump, chopped to deep point
full on leg stump, doesn't get to the pitch for the flick. It rolls back to the bowler

beaten in flight and he's lucky to get an outside edge on this as it turns away from him outside off. Pitch is slow so the bat has a chance as he looks to lift this over cover. Short third man cleans up to his right. Raza is bowling a superb speed
good length on off stump, defended from the crease
full outside off, steps out to meet it on the full and drives to mid-off
back of a length and turning into leg stump. Clipped to deep square off the back foot
short of a length and lifting up at off stump. Backs away and cuts to sweeper
back of a length and spinning into off stump. Allows it to turn in and nudges it wide of short third man
short of a length on off stump, punched to deep point
good length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket on the front foot
on a good length outside off, goes deep into the crease but cuts straight to point
back of a length outside off, grip off the surface and turns away from Tamim, cut in front of square off the back foot, goes to the man in the deep
full just outside off, prods forward and defends with the turn
full and loopy outside off, big stride forward and blocked
drops the length once again. Good length outside off, Tamim stays deep in his crease and cuts this late. Not the connection he was looking for
ends the over with a good-length ball outside off once more. Cut off the back foot to the man at point
back of a length on middle stump, but angling down the leg side, Tamim tries to flick fine down the leg side, but takes his thigh instead. Trickles down to short fine leg
good length on middle stump, Tamim stays in his crease and tries to pull this behind square, but played along the ground. Straight to square leg. Can't put the loose ball away
back of a length on middle again. Swivels and pulls once again, but to the man at square leg once more. Great diving effort
good length outside off, offers the straight bat and taps it down to mid on
full ball on middle stump, turns it behind square like a paddle shot, but once again the man at square leg is there for that shot
good length on middle and off, stays on the back foot and punches to cow corner
quicker ball, full outside off. Tries to drive away from his body, but slapped to the man at cover point
full on middle stump, down on one knee and swept along the ground. But straight to square leg
good length outside off, turns away from the left-hander, pokes at it and taps it to point
good length outside off, goes straight through this time. Shakib wants to cut but too close to his body. Chopped to point
full just outside off, punched back to Raza off the back foot

full but wide outside off, spins and turns further away from the left-hander. Shakib goes chasing after it, but he's too far for the cut. Hits the toe end of his bat, and through to point. Maiden over
back of a length on the fourth-stump line, Tamim covers his off-stump line and taps back to the bowler
good length on middle and off, cramps the batsman for room. Driven back to the bowler off the back foot
good length on middle stump, rocks back and punches firmly off the back foot to wide long on
quicker ball. Full on middle stump, and darted right in. Hurries Shakib to defend
floated up on off stump, Shakib tries to drive but hit too straight. Stopped by Waller on his follow through
tossed up outside off once more, struck firmly off the front foot, but intercepted by cover
back of a length outside off, spins away. Punched off the back foot to cover
full outside off, pushed back to Raza off the front foot
slower ball, on a good length outside off, cut off the back foot and it beats the two infielders. Work for Chatara in the deep, but he does well to cut the ball off
full outside off, Tamim tries an extravagant drive by getting down on one knee, but can't find the placement. Straight to cover
full on off stump, prods forward and tries to defend, but takes the thick outside edge to short third man
full on off stump, big stride ahead and defended by Tamim
short on off stump, and Shakib is quick to get into position and pull, but hit along the ground to cow corner
good length on off stump, punched off the back foot to deep midwicket on this occasion
back of a length on off stump, angling into Tamim, fended towards mid off
tossed up on off stump, steps forward and defends back to Waller
short on middle stump, stays deep in his crease and taps to the man at cow corner for a single
pitched up on off stump, eventually a low full toss for Shakib, but bunted back to Waller
full and wide outside off, driven crisply off the front foot, but can't beat the infielder
good length on middle stump, turned off his pads to square leg for a walking single
there's a bit of aggression, but falls short of long on. Full outside off, and Shakib tried to slog this away but the bat turns in his hand
full on middle stump, tapped to long on
back of a length outside off, tapped to point off the back foot
good length outside off, cut off the back foot to point. Enough time for them to take the run
good length on middle stump, turned off the hips to square leg off the back foot
good length on middle stump, punched off the back foot firmly past the non-striker to long on
good length on middle stump, worked off his pads to deep square leg. There's the team hundred
full on middle stump, worked off his hips to the man at midwicket
back of a length on middle stump, uses his wrists to play this towards cow corner
full on middle and leg, tapped past the non-striker but Waller does well to race to his left and stop the ball from going through
full outside off, forces the batsman to tentatively step forward, tries to defend but flies past the outside edge
good length outside off, spinning further away, Tamim cuts late but it's an excellent diving stop at short third man
good length outside off, punched off the back foot to mid off
good length outside off, cut off the back foot but once again, it's straight to short third man
pitched up full on middle stump, worked to wide mid on for a walking single
back of a length outside off, cut off the back foot and beats point. Races away to the backward point boundary, and that's Shakib's fifty!
full on off stump, driven to mid off off the front foot
back of a length outside off, angling into the batsman, tapped to cover off the back foot
full on middle stump, worked off his pads with soft hands to mid off
full on middle stump, forces the batsman to bring his bat down in a hurry. Fended back to Waller
full on off stump, turns away after pitching, pushed to cover
back of a length outside off, punched straight down the ground but intercepted by the bowler

tossed up full outside off, and entices Shakib to come down the ground. Attempts to lift this over the bowler's head but deceived by the spin! Turns away from his bat, and the keeper stumps him with ease. Raza with the breakthrough
full on off stump, turns into him, worked off his pads to short midwicket
full outside off, nudged off his pads towards square leg for a quick run
full on middle stump, pushed away from his body, and it's in the air! But flies just past Raza's right, and through to long off. There's Tamim's fifty as well!
full on middle and leg, worked off his legs to square leg once more
full on leg stump, driven off the front foot to long off
good length outside off, stays deep in his crease and punches towards deep midwicket. Played so softly that the outfielders race in to keep it down to only a single
good length on leg stump, walks across to the off side and taps off his hips to deep midwicket for a single
quicker ball, but short outside off, cut away from his body. Beats point, but there's the man in the deep for that shot
back of a length on middle stump, keeps his eyes on the ball and defends off the back foot from top of off stump
good length on middle stump once more, flicked off his pads to midwicket
full just outside off, eventually a low full toss. Hit off the toe end of the bat, back to the bowler, off the front foot
full outside off, Mushi charges down the ground and drives past the non-striker to long on
back of a length outside off, waits for the ball to cross him before tapping at it fine, beats Ervine at short third man, forcing the fielder to give it a chase. Parries it in just inside the ropes
full on middle and leg, fended towards the leg side off the front foot
full on off stump, spins away after gripping the surface, pokes at it and played to point
good length outside off, stays on the back foot and carves this towards cover point
full on off stump, turned with the spin off his hips to square leg. Raza finishes his spell with 1 for 39
full on off stump, and there's the first sign of aggression from the new man. Down on one knee, and slogged over midwicket. Lands a few feet beyond the boundary
good length on middle stump, takes an extra bounce off the surface. the batsman tried to get out of the ball's way, ut smacks his shoulder instead. Surprises everyone
good length on leg stump, turned off his pads to square leg for a comfortable run
full on middle stump, steps forward and taps to wide long on
good length outside leg stump, Mushfiqur walks across to the off side and turns this delivery to square leg
full outside off, and that's driven firmly past cover. Two men in the deep, but it's threaded the gap between those two. Beats both men, and that's the end of an expensive over from Waller
short and wide outside off, enough room for the batsman to put it away but the cut from Mushi is stopped by the diving backward-point fielder
full and wide outside off, tries to chase at it by trying to carve this square, but misses the shot
back of a length outside off, can't cut this away. Bottom edges it to point. Misses out on another loose, wide ball
good length on middle stump, flicked off his pads to deep backward square. They walk across for the single
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to cover. Got big on Mushi
back of a length outside off, pulled along the carpet to deep midwicket. Well hit but straight to the man
full outside off, turns away, driven back to Cremer
good length outside off, tries to cut but too close to his body. Played to short third man
tossed up on middle and leg, played off the front foot to wide long on
full on middle and leg, turning into Tamim, worked off his pads to square leg
back of a length outside off, rocks back and punches off the back foot to the bowler
down the wicket, and converts this into a full toss. Muscled over the bowler to long on
full and wide outside off, tries to cut behind square but doesn't have the direction. Straight to point
back of a length outside off, angling into the right hander, driven to mid off. But can't find the gap
good length outside off, angling into the batsman again. Flicked off his pads to deep backward square
back of a length on leg stump, tapped to square leg for a quick single. Late response from Tamim for the single, but they scamper through eventually
full outside off, charges down the ground and tries to slog. Takes the inside edge and onto his pads
back of a length outside off, extra pace off the surface! Zips past his outside edge as the batsman tries to play off the back foot
tossed up on off stump, driven to wide long on and there's the 6000th run for Tamim Iqbal in ODIs!
full on off stump, tries to sweep and takes the top edge. Deceived by the pace in the air, and it's caught by short fine leg
tossed up full on off stump, driven firmly back past the bowler to mid off
back of a length outside off, stays low, cut off the back foot to cover
full on middle stump, it's a low full toss, tapped back to the bowler
full outside off, spins away from him, opens the bat's face and nudges it to point
good length on middle stump, angling away from Tamim. Pokes at it, and plays it with the bat's open face to point
full and slow outside off, and it's smacked over the bowler's head! Beats mid off, and races away to the long-off boundary
short on middle stump, but soars over the batsman's head. Good, effort delivery, but too high
good length on middle stump, glanced off the back foot to third man
back of a length outside off, fishes at it and plays it to point with soft hands. Calls for an early single, and easily completed
good length on off stump, once again Tamim opens the bat's face and runs it down to third man
back of a length wide outside off, guided off the back foot to the right-hander's third man on this occasion. Time for drinks

trapped in front by a googly. Doesn't pick it as he pushes forward on the front foot. He's convinced that he has no bat on this. He's walking off. Half-stride with bat behind the pad as he shapes to leave what he thinks is a legbreak outside off. Trapped right in front of off stump and that's another plumb lbw wicket this innings
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
beats the outside edge as he presses forward to try and defend this dipping ball outside off
back of a length on middle stump, whipped to deep square off the back foot
good length on leg stump, stretches forward and flicks to short fine
full outside off, flicks on the rise to long-on
checks the hook and just manages to clear midwicket. Short ball gets big on him at an off stump line and he's not confident as he plays the shot
back of a length and in at off stump. Inside edge onto boot as he hangs the bat at this away from the body
short of a length ball nudged into the square leg area with the angle
short ball slanted across off stump and he ramps it towards third man
short ball spits up at him and comes into his chest. He looks to guide it to third man and ends up gloving it narrowly past the keeper
good length outside off, steered to third man

outfoxes him! Cremer gets another one with the googly. Good length ball on off stump, hung up generously and dipping fast. Tamim steps out and wants to slog this over the midwicket boundary, but it turns away from him and he's woefully out of shape by the end of it all. Easy stumping for Taylor
length ball just outside off, stabbed through point on the front foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length just outside off stump, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
googly lifts up at Nasir as he presses forward for the defence. Forced to jab it into the turf
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length and just outside off, defended to point
inside edge zips past the stumps as he tried to chop this length ball outside off. Didn't get close enough to the ball and it slid low. Fine leg cleans up

Ervine has plucked out a stunner! This is something! He's leaped one-handed to his left at short midwicket and somehow got his hand under it. Superb. It's a short ball from Jarvis, on a middle and off line. The pull shot is nailed off the middle of the bat and dips on Ervine, but he's got down rapidly and done this with some craft. Despite the speed at which he had to move, he completes the catch nicely with a soft landing and a firm elbow
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length just outside off, drops it into the turf in front of point
back of a length outside off, can't beat Raza at backward point as he stabs at this with no feet
tossed up on middle stump, watches it come on and pushes it back to the bowler
back of a length and pushed through in the corridor, hurriedly tapped to extra cover
back of a length and in at the pads, dabbed through midwicket off the back foot
beats the outside edge and raps him on the back thigh as he looks to defend this leg stump ball into the leg side
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up on off stump, beats the bat on the outside edge as Mashrafe looks to defend
short ball outside off and he misses the attempted pull shot by a long way. Too early on that

is that an edge? Yes it is! Bangladesh sliding rapidly. Offcutter dug in at short of a length and wide outside off. Grips the surface and climbs up as Nasir brings out the late cut. Once again he's through the shot early and the ball kisses the outside edge on the way up. Dips in front of Taylor who scoops it up
good length on off stump, defended down the pitch
full outside off stump, pushed to extra cover on the front foot
offcutter on the pads at a good length. Flicked to deep square
full on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
back of a length and ripping into the mid-riff as he goes on the back foot. Deflected towards short third man off the thigh guard

looks like Cremer has his 100th ODI wicket. But we have to wait for confirmation because Mashrafe has reviewed this caught behind decision. This straightens in the corridor and he pokes the bat out. There is a slight sound as it passes the bat....and UltraEdge confirms that. He didn't look sure about hitting that, and asked the partner if there was a sound. But there's enough evidence. He's out
nicely timed drive. Meets this full ball on the pitch outside off and drives firmly but mid-off dives to his left to cut that off
back of a length slider outside off, cut straight to extra cover
good length on middle stump, big inside edge to short fine as he looks to defend on the front foot
short and wide outside off, backs away and cuts it wide of backward point to beat him
full toss outside off, looks to drive through cover and gets it out to long-on off the inside half of the bat
overpitched outside off, driven to sweeper cover on the front foot
full and wide outside off, chases it and ends up slicing aerially towards sweeper cover
offcutter, back of a length in the corridor. Waits for it to come on and runs it to third man
offcutter on a length outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
good length and sliding through very low outside off as he hangs the bat out
good length outside off, pushed to extra cover
length on middle stump, tapped back to the bowler
full toss at off, driven expansively towards mid-off
length ball outside off, sliding through with the angle. Pushed towards short third man
full outside off, looks to hit through cover. Ball rolls out to midwicket off the inside half
back of a length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket's left
short and wide outside off, too far for the batsman to make connection on the cut
good length in the corridor, pushed to point with an open face
outside edge and there's no one at slip. It's a poor ball, lots of width for the No. 9 to swing his bat at. Third man has no chance
full and just outside off, flicked to long-on with the angle
back of a length outside off, beaten on the outside edge as he looks to guide it to third man
back of a length outside off, beaten again as he attempts the same shot
length ball outside off, zips past the outside edge as he wafts at this
tossed up outside off, gets to the pitch and drives to long-off's right
good length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket's left on the front foot
good length on off stump, defended into the leg side off the inside half
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length on off stump, steps out and drives straight back to the bowler
good length on middle stump, reaches out and gets low to connect nicely on this sweep and bisect deep square and deep midwicket
offcuter, full on off stump. Defended into the off side from the crease
offcutter at a length on leg stump. Pushed to short fine and they manage to steal a single despite a mix-up
short ball angled in at the batsman, who steps out and cramps himself. Can't get bat on the hoick
offcutter, jags away off the surface and beats the outside edge as he pushes forward
good length and in at middle stump, tapped to deep midwicket from the crease
back of a length on off stump, backs away and pushes it straight to backward point

taken at short fine by Muzarabani. If the Leaning Tower ever falls, it'll look like that. Chatara bounces the advancing batsman who can't connect on the hook. Top edge hangs up and to the right of Muzarabani, who follows it like he's in a trance, stretches out his long hands, takes the catch and falls down in slo-mo
short and wide outside off, slashes and misses
that's a cruel wide calls. Floats this slower ball full and wide outside off. It lands inside the tram line, but the umpire doesn't reckon so
short ball outside off, slashes and misses
inside edge as he doesn't pick this slower ball. It beats Taylor to his right. It's a full toss that he's looking to heave
short ball in at off stump, steps out and ends up slicing this over point after getting cramped
short and wide outside off, cut straight to point
offcutter skids under the slog, and rolls out to the keeper from wide outside off

shot! He has drilled this straight over the bowler. His front foot is stretched out and facing midwicket, in true No. 11 fashion, but the bat has come from under this overpitched ball on middle and he clears the boundary with a flat hit
short of a length outside off, inside edge and into the leg side as he looks to pull

offcutter on a length at off stump, backs away and chips this straight towards mid-off...who shies at the stumps as Rubel looks to make his way back. Hits the stumps and it deflects into the slips region for an overthrow
offcutter on a length outside off, hangs deep in the crease and slogs across the line to get this down to long-on

swipes it to the square leg boundary. Length ball in at the pads, an offcutter, and he gets behind it and swings to beat deep square to his left. That's his highest score in senior cricket, across formats

good length on middle stump, tries to whip this square off the back foot, and they're off for a slow single. Mire's quick, but is he quick enough? Quick work from the fielder at point, and the keeper breaks the stumps. They're going up to the third umpire! It's not out.
full just outside off, big stride forward and defend. Takes the inside edge and flies away towards square leg
full on off stump, pushed past the bowler's left to mid off
good length outside off, big stride forward and defended
full on middle and leg, tries a big sweep but he misses the shot. The keeper can't get behind it either. Beats Mushfiqur, and races away therafter
tossed up full on off stump, prods forward and defends
good length on middle and leg, tries to work it behind square off his pads, but misses
on a good length outside off, but swinging further away from the right hander. He's got to bowl that one again
on a good length outside off stump, swings away after pitching. Masakadza shoulders his arms
on a good length outside off stump, shapes away once again. Left alone after covering his off-stump line
full outside off, and zips off the surface! Extra bounce after pitching outside the stumps, and through to the keeper
full just outside off, prods forward and defends firmly towards the cover region
full on middle and leg, angling into his pads and put away off his legs. Flicked past midwicket, forcing the fielder to give it a chase

good length on off stump, punched straight down the ground off the back foot. Punched too well, infact. Smashes straight into the stumps at the non-striker's end, but the ricochet allows them to scamper through for the single

full outside off, prods forward and tries to defend, but played down the wrong line. Raps him in front of the stumps, and that's a big appeal for lbw. Turned down, but they're reviewing! Was impact just outside off? That would save Masakadza, otherwise Hammy looks plumb. Ball tracking says impact was outside off stump. That's a wasted review.
tossed up on the channel just outside off, big stride forward from the batsman, but he defends inside the line of the ball. The delivery zips past his outside edge. So close.
on a good length on off stump, tapped back to Shakib
tossed up on middle and off, spins away after pitching, defended back to the bowler
good length outside off, forces the batsman to rock back. Punched off the back foot, but straight to cover
back of a length outside off, angling into the big right hander. Cramped for space, but does well to cut this away. Can't beat the man at point, though
good length wide outside off, entices Mire to chase at it. Slight swing away from the right hander, and that forces him to miss
good length on middle and leg, tapped off his pads to midwicket
good length on middle and leg, tries to flick this fine behind square but misses as the ball goes down the leg side. Sharp take from the keeper, diving to his left

there's the big one! Back of a length outside off, angling away from Hammy after pitching. He tried to punch at it, but it's so far away from his body. Takes a thick outside edge, and easily pocketed by first slip
full on middle and off, defended firmly off the front foot
beautiful delivery! Full on off stump and Ervine shoulders his arms. But the ball straightened oh-so-slightly, eventually going just over the top of off stump
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to cover
full outside off, driven on the up, but can't breach the infield. Straight to cover
back of a length outside off, turns away after pitching, punched off the back foot to mid off
full on off stump, strides forward and defends back to Shakib
back of a length outside off, but it's the quicker one! Angling into Mire, who tries to cut late, but it's too close to him. Goes just past off stump. Very close to the second wicket
back of a length outside off, spins away, smacked off the back foot to cover point
full on middle and leg, turned off his hips as the ball races down the leg side
full on off stump, shuffles across to the off side and drives past the non-striker to mid on
full outside off, tries to drive past cover but comes off the bat's toe end. Trickles away towards the off side
back of a length on middle and leg, clipped off his hips to midwicket for a quick run
full on off stump, tapped down the ground to mid off for a quick single. It's dangerous, but the fielder misses the direct hit. He would've been out if the throw hit the stumps

in the air, but falls beyond Rubel! Full outside off, and tries to lift this over the infield. The bat turned in his hand, thereby popping the ball up. Mid off chased behind it, but just not quick enough. Living dangerously, Mire
back of a length outside off, angling into him and pulled over midwicket. Only a single as the ball goes to the man in the deep
full outside off, Mire tries to slog sweep over midwicket, but misses. Well taken by the keeper
on a good length outside off, tapped towards the off side after coming forward
back of a length outside off, goes deep into the crease and pulls in front of the wicket. Straight to mid on, who forces the batsmen to turn down the single
good length on off stump, muscled back to the bowler
you miss, I hit! Slow and loopy on middle stump. Mire tries to slog this far too early, and plays through even before the ball got to him. Sneaks under his bat, and crashes into middle stump

on a hat-trick! Gone first ball! Full on middle stump, but Taylor's gone back instead of coming forward. Misses the flick off his pads, and the ball raps him on the pads. Impact in front of the stumps, and Taylor's walking back. Easy lbw decision for the umpire. Taylor's horrid form continues
full on off stump, and that's beautifully driven past the non-striker. Firmly hit, and mid off has no chance either. Textbook shot
good length outside off stump, tries to defend but takes the shoulder of his bat. Flies away towards the leg side
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to cover. Sharp stop from the fielder
full and wide outside off, driven square off the front foot past cover point. There's protection in the deep, though
full on off stump, walks across to the off side before defending towards mid on
full outside off, big stride ahead and fended by Raza. Shows the full face of the bat, which is always promising
so close, but nope! Good length outside off, but it's the straight one. Zips straight through past the bat's outside edge
full on middle stump, comes down the ground and taps it back to the bowler
full on middle and leg, and it's been swept away! Beats square leg, and then the man at deep fine leg as well
good length outside off, shimmies down before tapping this back to Shakib
back of a length on off stump, spins into Ervine. The ball stays low, but punched off the back foot to mid on
full outside off, and it's been smacked over the bowler's head! Comes down the wicket and gets under the ball. Lifted over mid off as the ball crashes into the boundary
back of a length on middle and off, punched off the back foot to Mashrafe. Played with soft hands

sharp take from first slip! Back of a length on off stump, he goes chasing behind the ball that's angling away. Takes a thick outside edge, and the ball was dipping on the fielder, but he dives forward to complete an excellent catch. Zimbabwe in big trouble
good length outside off, played off the back foot towards cover. Hit with the straight bat
short ball just outside off, gets big on Moor as he tries to defend with soft hands. But the ball goes past his bat's outside edge

short and wide outside off, pokes at it and makes enough contact behind that shot. Finds the gap between cover and point, and races away after that. No chance for the infielder who tries to chase behind it
back of a length outside off, tapped off the back foot but takes a thick outside edge. Trickles down to third man instead

good length on off stump, angling into the right hander as he plays for the turn. Sneaks through between bat and pad as he attempts to defend. Hits his pads, and it's a big appeal for lbw. Given by the umpire, but Moor reviews! Replays show there's an inside edge off the bat. No wonder he reviewed so fast
tossed up full outside off, big stride forward and defended with soft hands
good length on leg stump, tentatively works it towards the leg side but misses the shot. Hits his pad instead
back of a length outside off, punched with ease off the back foot past the bowler's right
good length outside off, winds up and cuts, but it's in the air! Falls just short of point, and spins away from the fielder. There's the man in the deep, though
full outside off, defends off the front foot but comes off the inside edge. Ricochets onto his boots, but does not trickle onto the stumps
good length on off stump, he shuffles across to the off side and flicks it to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length outside off, Sikandar pokes at it but can't make contact. The ball holds its line as it zips past the bat's outside edge. Groans from the keeper and the bowler
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to the bowler
full outside off, and it's a slower ball on this occasion. It's too wide for Raza to chase at it. Left alone
full outside off, walks across to the off side and taps it with the bat's open face to cover point. Can't beat the infield

short outside off, and Raza walks across to the off side and pulls emphatically! Great sound off the bat, and the ball soars over the deep midwicket boundary. Was quick to get into position early, and then went through with the shot
full on off stump, tapped down the ground to long off and there's the team fifty!
full on middle and off, once again driven down the ground to long off. And that's 2000 career ODI runs for Raza
pushed full outside off, big stride forward and tries to drive. Played down the wrong line, though, as the ball flies past his outside edge
full on off stump, prods forward and fends back to Sunzamul
full on leg stump, tapped off his boots towards midwicket. No single on offer
tossed up for the last ball, but firmly defended with soft hands to see the over out.
good length on leg stump, but angling across the right hander. Defended off the back foot
on a good length on middle stump, angling across once again. Tried to drive away from his body, but played down the wrong line. The ball goes across his bat's face and through to the keeper
good length on middle stump, angling away like always, tries to shoulder his arms but too slow. Pings off his bat to cover as he tried to get it out of the way
full on off stump, defended off the front foot
back of a length on leg stump, nudged off his pads to midwicket
full on off stump, big stride forward from Raza before he chooses to let it go. Through to the keeper, but the ball stays low. Maiden over
full outside off, big stride forward and defended with soft hands
tossed up outside off, spins away from Moor after pitching. Tries to defend off the front foot, but the extra spin takes it just past his outside edge
tossed up on middle and leg, hit firmly down the ground to wide long off
full on off stump, straightens after pitching this time. Defended off the front foot
tossed up on middle stump, hit down the ground, but well stopped by Sunzamul
tossed up on middle stump, hit firmly down the ground to long off
back of a length outside off stump, rocks back and punched with the bat's open face to cover point
good length on off stump, angling across once again as Raza walks to the off side and cover his stumps. Well left
back of a length outside off, angles across Raza's body once again. Shoulders his arms
good length outside off stump, goes straight through to the keeper. Raza chooses not to play at it
back of a length outside off, angles away and through to Mushi. Left alone once again
full outside off, tries to drive at it but misses. Stays low, as the keeper collects diving forward. Two maidens in a row for Fizz
back of a length outside off, carved off the back foot to cover point
full on leg stump, tapped down the ground to long on
tossed up on off stump, entices Moor to slog at it. But it's the one that straightens, and Moor plays all around that shot. Through to the keeper, who can't hold on to it either
back of a length outside off, extra bounce after pitching! Tries to cut, but he's miles away
good length on middle and off, forces Moor to go back into his crease. Punched back to Sunzamul
back of a length outside off, spins away after pitching. Tapped to cover
good length on middle stump, defended with soft hands from in front of middle stump. Played with the angled bat
good length on middle stump, left alone as the ball goes past his pads
back of a length outside off, left alone by Raza as the angled ball goes past him
full on middle stump, shuffles across to the off side and defended back
back of a length outside off, left alone by the batsman once more
full outside off, chases behind it by trying to drive, but misses. That's his third maiden in a row!
good length and in at leg stump, pushed to midwicket on the front foot
good length and into the pads, deflected towards short fine leg off the pads as he looks to flick
good length on off stump, defended into the covers on the front foot
length ball pushed down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
tossed up at off stump, driven to extra cover on the front foot
floated up outside off, driven to sweeper cover on the front foot
good length on off stump, defended to point on the front foot
good length and slanted across off stump, beaten on the outside edge
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended to cover from the crease
back of a length, pushed across off stump. Looks to tap this into the leg side off the back foot to steal a single. But the bowler won't allow it
good length and wide outside off, beaten as he stabs away from the body
aaand there it goes. A 23-ball streak. Full one outside off and he leans into the drive to sweeper cover
length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, pushed to point off the back foot
back of a length on leg stump, pushed through square leg off the back foot
full outside off, sliced to point on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, makes room and cuts it to sweeper cover
tossed up on off stump, leans in and drives to long-off
oh this close on the lbw appeal. Length ball sliding and catching him in the crease in front of middle and leg. Mortaza gives it out. He doesn't have a review left
length outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
shot. This is a length ball that sits up for him outside off and he moves his weight onto the back foot quickly to hammer it to the midwicket boundary
length and coming in at leg stump, pushed into the vacant midwicket region
short ball at an off stump line, arches backwards to let it pass
a bouncer. This one more short and more steep. He drops his wrists and lets it go
tossed up on leg stump, swept straight to short fine
good length on middle stump, dead-batted on the front foot
good length at middle stump, swept to deep square
given out lbw. Slides past his inside edge and strikes him in front of middle stump. He was looking to defend for the turn and completely missed the line of this slider. Huge gap between bat and pad

lbw review. Waller has looked to play the paddle sweep first up and missed it. Looks to be struck on a middle stump line. The ball hasn't risen too much. I reckon the only way he survives this is if he has got bat or glove on it. We're waiting for Ultra Edge...no bat involved. Tracking has him dead in front. That's hitting middle and off. He's gone.
tossed up outside off stump, driven straight to extra cover
short and wide outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
short and wide outside off, cut to point off the toe-end of the bat
short and wide outside off, under-edges the cut into the point region
back of a length and in at off stump, tapped to extra cover on the up
short and in the corridor, mistimed pull to mid-on
back of a length in the corridor, wafts inside the line and is beaten on the outside edge
floated up outside off, leans in and squeezes it through the covers on the front foot
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
good length on off stump, pushed towards long-off but extra cover cuts it off on the way
short and just outside off. Waits late and slices it late, past point. Backward point is too square to have a chance
good length and in at leg stump, flicked to deep square off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended into the covers
good length and in at leg stump, he shovels it to mid-on and steals a single. For his effort, he gets a reward. Overthrows, through extra cover
full and hooping in towards off stump. Taps it on the up to extra cover
slower ball at off stump, flicked wide of mid-on with the cutter
short ball just outside off, cuts on the bounce to point
narrowly misses off stump as Cremer looks to whip this back of a length ball through midwicket. The ball doesn't rise as much as he expects and this climbs over off stump
back of a length at off stump, mistimed pull wide of mid-on
full and drifted in at middle stump, driven to long-off
length ball pushed flat outside off. Steps out and is forced to block it with his pad after he's beaten in flight
beaten in flight again after stepping out. Closer to the ball this time and ends up blocking
length on off stump, driven to long-off
lbw appeal as the bat and pad are jammed close together on the front foot defence. There was an inside edge on it, but it's unclear whether it came first
floated up at off stump, driven to long-off
overpitched inswinger on off stump, driven straight to mid-off
good length and wide outside off, left alone
bouncer dug too short, ducks under it without fuss
back of a length and climbing up as he looks to defend. Looks like a cutter. Hits the sticker of the bat and lobs up momentarily
nicely put away. Another short of a length ball at off stump, this time with consistent bounce. He stands tall and slaps this to the midwicket boundary on the up
full outside off, leans in and drives to sweeper's right
back of a length wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up on off stump, pushed aerially towards extra cover
whack. Dropped short on off stump, gets deep in the crease and swats this to the midwicket boundary with a clean swing
full on off stump, driven back to the bowler
back of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on's right off the back foot
there can be no doubt here. Cremer stuck in the crease. The ball skids in, too quick for him as he looks to flick. On the knee roll, in front of middle stump. Umpires gives it
indipper again, full at middle stump. Pushes on the front foot, gets an inside edge to midwicket
low full toss outside off, driven back to the bowler on the bounce
back of a length outside off, pushed to point off the back foot
good length in the corridor, defended into the covers
inswinger in the corridor, defended down the pitch
loopy full one outside off, drilled straight to extra cover
good length outside off, pushed to extra cover on the front foot
good length on off stump, defended to point off the outside half
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover after stepping out
full outside off, leans in, beaten
back of a length on middle stump, pushed to mid-on off the back foot
length on middle stump, steps out and looks to slog over midwicket. Inside edge rolls out to square leg
short ball wide outside off, goes deep in the crease and spanks it over extra cover
arm ball headed for middle stump, makes him back away a long way and he just manages to get bat on the attempted cut
length and in at leg stump, punched to deep midwicket off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
length on off stump, pushed to point on the front foot
lovely shot. Steps out and gets leg side of this length ball angled across him. Slaps it on the up to clear mid-off very deliberately
inside edge misses off stump and runs past Rahim. He's looking to cut this, but it keeps low. Fine leg cleans up to his right

drags it on. Picks the offcutter and plays what he will think is a poor shot. It's back of a length and climbing up wide outside off. He walks into it and can't get on top of the bounce. This is especially important, because the shot he's looking to play is a flick. The ball's going away from him all the time. He can only manage an inside edge onto leg stump

edge doesn't carry to slip and he can't stop it either. Sneaks through from between his legs and into the boundary. A proper offcutter, in at off stump on a length, drawing him forward and getting the edge
back of a length offcutter zips away from him as he steps out and looks to slog over midwicket
good length on off stump, defended to point off the outside half of the bat
back of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length on the pads, goes on the back foot and misses the glance
swings and connects. Length ball outside off. Reaches out and drags it to the wide long-on boundary
back of a length on off stump, defended into the covers off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, punched off the back foot to mid on. No single on offer
full on off stump, smacked back to Fizz off the front foot
back of a length outside off, carved off the back foot to point. Misfield there, allows them to scamper through
back of a length outside off, comes charging down the ground to slog this over the leg side, but he misses the shot completely. Goes under his bat and just past the outside of off stump
good length on middle and off, Chatara defends firmly after getting his body behind the ball

good length on middle stump, angling away from the tailender. Tries to poke at it with the angled bat, and the ball takes a feather-edge off the bat's surface. The ball's dipping, and forces the keeper to dive forward, but he misses the catch. Pops out of his hand as he tries to control himself. Goes down as a dropped
full on off stump, driven down the ground to long on. Firmly hit back
full just outside off, Chatara tries to defend but the ball turns away from his bat's face. Big appeal for the caught behind or lbw, but the umpire is not interested
easily taken at cow corner! Full on middle and Chatara goes for the slog, comes off the bat's toe end and it's only going down the throat of the man at wide long on
good length on middle and leg, whipped easily off his pads to deep midwicket. They want the second run, and they scamper through
tossed up full outside off, drives with the bat's open face behind square
full on off, muscled towards midwicket but no run on offer
full on middle stump, and smacked over Fizz. No stopping that as the ball races away to the long off boundary
pocketed by mid off! And it's all over. Full on off stump and smacked over the bowler's head. But no real power behind that. Taken by mid off with ease!
